articles.title: About me
articles.description:
Postdoctoral researcher
Centre for Water Resources Studies
Dalhousie University
Halifax, NS, CAN
articles.contents:
My research interests include drinking/source water quality and
treatment, water quality data analysis, and corrosion as it relates to
drinking water quality. I study the occurrence and mobility of lead and
copper in drinking water, the impact of iron corrosion on water quality,
and changes in source water bodies that impact drinking water quality
(e.g., brownification, cyanobacteria).

articles.title: Benjamin Trueman
articles.description:
Postdoctoral researcher  
Department of Civil & Resource Engineering  
Dalhousie University  
Halifax, NS, CAN
articles.contents:
Website: https://bentrueman.github.io
Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.ca/citations?user=V1hY9TkAAAAJ&hl=en
Academic background
2018 PhD, Civil Engineering
Dalhousie University, Halifax, NS
Thesis title: “Controlling Lead Release To Drinking Water: Impacts Of
Iron Oxides, Complexing Species, Orthophosphate, And Lead Pipe
Replacement”
2012 BSc, Environmental Science
Dalhousie University, Halifax, NS
Skills
R programming (https://github.com/bentrueman) and data analysis (e.g.,
https://doi.org/10.26434/chemrxiv-2022-b3f72-v4)
Geochemical modeling with applications in corrosion control
Developed an R package for predicting lead and copper solubility
using PHREEQC, available at https://github.com/bentrueman/pbcusol

Communication
Wrote or co-wrote more than 30 peer-reviewed journal articles
Presented at international academic conferences
